IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To assist in the development of Christ-centered ministries in the areas of health and human care.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Called by Christ to serve others, We Raise Foundation partners with Christian organizations to support and develop sustainable programs that help people thrive.
IRS990.Desc: Expenses for the education, training and support of professionals and other leaders in the Christian community that are involved in designing or operating projects. We Raise Foundation hosted and presented workshops at several events throughout the year including educational convenings for grantees and workshops for leaders interested in starting new health and human care ministry projects.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: 33 grants awarded to exempt organizations for the purpose of starting new health and human care ministry projects, and the direct expenses of internally funded and directed projects. The 33 grant programs supported by We Raise Foundation served a total of 39,752 unique individuals between July 2017 and June 2018. The grant programs supported by We Raise Foundation during the past year also engaged a total of 4,873 unique volunteers in service.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Expenses incurred for the review, evaluation, selection and awarding of project grants, and support for internally funded and directed projects. We Raise Foundation employed three full time staff members and invested in the technology and supplies needed to vet over 116 grant proposals received during the year, awarded 33 new grants, and evaluated, managed, and provided assistance and consulting to active grantees.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: Funds held in trust by others

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The endowment consists of 15 individual funds established for a variety of purposes. The endowment includes both donor restricted endowment funds and funds designated by the Board to function as endowments in the furtherance of the mission of We Raise Foundation.
Expenditures are accounted for using the accrual method of accounting.

USAddress.AddressLine1Txt: 1849 N Dr Martin Luther King Dr Ste

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: At Ease Ministry to Incarcerated Veterans

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: By The Hand Club For Kids

Skip the Grid - Solar Powering Off-Grid Healthcare
Peace not Walls Young Adult Engagement Strategy
Expansion of Healthy Living Programs for Teens
Reflecting God's Grace to Victims and Survivors of Sex Trafficking
Increasing Help Care Clinic's Capacity to Serve

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Guidelines are the same whether grants are domestic or international. Grant fund recipients must comply with grant guidelines for applying for and obtaining funds. Once funds are obtained by the grantee, regular financial reporting is required by We Raise Foundation in order to maintain funds and to acquire any future grants.
The number of contributions represent the number of contributions received, not the number of items donated.

In FY18, Ramsdale Stamp Company was used to auction off the remainder of stamps from a collection received as a donation. This was a special situation and not something that is done on a regular basis.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 1
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Committee is composed of the Board Chair, Vice Chair, and Secretary as well as the Chairs of Board Standing Committees. The Board Chair serves as Chair of the Executive Committee. The Executive Committee may act on behalf of the Board in all matters delegated to it by specific action or by policy of the Board. Actions of the Executive Committee are reported in writing to the Board at the next meeting of the Board.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Director of Finance role is filled by representatives of Vector CFO, which provides permanent part time CFO services to the organization. During the year Matt Croll and Ronda Bischoff were the representatives of Vector CFO. Compensation paid to the firm totaled $100,250 for the calendar year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The bylaws and the articles of organization were updated for the name change from Wheat Ridge Ministries to We Raise Foundation and to reflect the new vision and mission of the organization.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: We Raise Foundation's Form 990 is prepared by an independent CPA firm. The Director of Finance reviews in detail the Form 990. Then a copy is provided to the Audit & Finance committee to review. After their review, the Audit & Finance Committee makes a recommendation to the Board of Directors to approve the Form 990. The Board of Directors reviews and approves the Form 990 before it is filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Annual conflict of interest forms are completed by all Board members and officers. Transactions with officers, directors and key employees are deliberately avoided. Should any potential conflicts of interest be disclosed, the board member or officer would be asked to refrain from participation in any deliberation or decision with regard to matters affected by the relationship.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The process of determining compensation includes all of the following elements: 1. Review and approval: The compensation of the President is reviewed annually and approved by the Board of Directors or Executive Committee of the organization, provided that persons with conflicts of interest with respect to the compensation arrangement at issue are not involved in this review and approval. The compensation for all other employees is reviewed annually by the President/CEO. 2. Use of data as to comparable compensation: The compensation of the person is reviewed and approved using comparable compensation data for similarly qualified persons in functionally comparable positions at similarly situated organizations. 3. Suitable documentation and recordkeeping: There is suitable documentation and recordkeeping with respect to the deliberations and decisions regarding this compensation agreement.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization makes its financial statements available to the public through the organization's website. The organization does not make its governing documents or conflict of interest policy available to the public at this time.
The organization's Board assumes responsibility for oversight of the audit of its financial statements and selection of its independent accountant. This process has not changed since the prior year.
